definition[0]: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way
example[0]: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
example[1]: The company is suing a former employee.
example[2]: The railway may sue for damages  (=in order to get money) because of loss of revenue.
example[3]: He is being sued for divorce  (=in order to end a marriage) by his wife.
example[4]: Miss James could not afford to sue for libel.
example[5]: She was suing doctors for negligence over the loss of her child.
definition[1]: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for an amount of money, because you have been harmed in some way
example[6]: The company was sued for nonpayment by their supplier.
